conclusion: Block a is initially at rest at point A, block b is initially at height h, the string remains taut, and block a collides with block b at the lowest point of the conveyor belt.
Since block a is initially at rest, its initial velocity v0 is zero.
The velocity of block b immediately after the collision is calculated as vb = v - h = 2 - 1.25 = 0.75 m/s.
Since the string remains taut, the velocity of block a immediately after the collision is the same as the velocity of block b before the collision, which is 0.75 m/s.
The coefficient of kinetic friction μ = 0.5, and the frictional force f = μmg = 0.5 × 2 × 10 = 10 N.
The frictional force acts over the distance d = l = 1 m, and the frictional force f = 10 N acts over this distance.
The distance d is calculated as d = f / (μmg) = 10 / (0.5 × 2 × 10) = 1 m.
The final velocity vf of block a is the same as the velocity vb immediately after the collision, which is 0.75 m/s.
Since block a comes to rest without bouncing, the final velocity vf is the same as the initial velocity v0.
The magnitude of the velocity v0 of block a immediately after the collision is 0.75 m/s.
